snippet: The two largest mutual funds specializing in health care — from Vanguard and T. Rowe Price — both have new managers.
abstract: Two largest mutual funds specializing in health care, Vanguard Health Care and T Rowe Price Health Sciences, recently lost their longtime managers; Vanguard's fund holds $25 billion in assets and T Rowe's Price fund about $6 billion; departures offer investors chance to assess whether funds can continue to put up good returns and whether they, or any other health care funds, have a place in an equity portfolio.
lead_paragraph: The two largest mutual funds specializing in health care — from Vanguard and T. Rowe Price — both have new managers.

headline.seo: Health Care Mutual Funds, With New Faces at the Helm
headline.main: Health Policy Is in Flux, and So Are 2 Health Funds
headline.print_headline: Health Policy Is in Flux, and So Are Funds

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
